DataElement.preferredName: Barrett Esophagus Extension Measurement Centimeter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numerical response that indicates the location of Barrett's Esophagus measured in centimeters.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Esophageal lesion lined with columnar metaplastic epithelium which is flat or villiform. Barrett epithelium is characterized by two different types of cells: goblet cells and columnar cells. The symptomatology of Barrett esophagus is that of gastro-esophageal reflux. It is the precursor of most esophageal adenocarcinomas.  (WHO)_To increase in length or duration.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Esophageal segment lined with columnar metaplastic epithelium which is flat or villiform.  Barrett's epithelium is characterized by two different types of cells: goblet cells and columnar cells.  The symptomatology of Barrett's esophagus is that of gastro-esophageal reflux.  It is the precursor of most esophageal adenocarcinomas.  (WHO, 2000) -- 2003

Concepts.definition: Esophageal lesion lined with columnar metaplastic epithelium which is flat or villiform. Barrett epithelium is characterized by two different types of cells: goblet cells and columnar cells. The symptomatology of Barrett esophagus is that of gastro-esophageal reflux. It is the precursor of most esophageal adenocarcinomas.  (WHO)

Property.preferredDefinition: An addition to the length of something; the spreading of something into new regions.

Concepts.definition: To increase in length or duration.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something._A centimeter is a basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's anatomic organs.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.:A centimeter is a basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
